properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow combined with strong winds will reduce visibilities to near zero over these regions on Thursday. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-26T01:22:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-25T09:23:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3773863846.2020
Area: Akulivik, Puvirnituq
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for this morning into the afternoon. Snowfall amounts of 5 to 10 centimetres are expected with the heaviest snow falling this morning. The snow is forecast to end early this afternoon. Travel is expected to be impacted due to moderate to heavy snow. Motorists should be prepared for winter weather driving conditions. A risk of freezing drizzle will follow the snow into this evening, predominantly for locations in the vicinity of the Ottawa River. This freezing precipitation may make roads slippery overnight. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-26T05:29:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-25T13:30:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3007067325.2020
Area: Gatineau, Merrickville-Wolford - Kemptville, Maxville - Alexandria, Cornwall - Lancaster, Winchester - Newington, Morrisburg - Long Sault, Prescott and Russell, Petawawa - Pembroke - Cobden, Renfrew - Arnprior - Calabogie, Smiths Falls - Perth - Eastern Lanark County, Ottawa North - Kanata - Orl√©ans, Ottawa South - Richmond - Metcalfe

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A low pressure system will bring a mix of rain and snow to Southern Quebec overnight tonight. During the changeover from snow to rain, an area of freezing rain may be possible early Thursday morning. Freezing precipitation could make roads slippery on Thursday morning. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-26T00:34:33-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-25T08:35:33-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0579047298.2020

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of about 15 cm is expected. A frontal system moving through southeastern British Columbia continues to bring snow to the region. Snow will become at times heavy on Highway 3 - Paulson Summit to Kootenay Pass tonight before tapering off early tomorrow morning as the system exits the region. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-25T16:01:37-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-25T00:02:37-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2682387582.2020
Area: Highway 3 - Paulson Summit to Kootenay Pass
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. An approaching cold front will move through Qikiqtarjuaq this morning, with north to northwest winds strengthening to the 60 gusting 80 km/h range along with snow, blowing snow, and blizzard conditions. The blizzard will continue through the morning, with conditions starting to improve in the afternoon. During the worst of the blizzard, visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected in the area. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-26T01:19:29-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-25T09:20:29-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3896997650.2020
Area: Qikiqtarjuaq
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 15 cm is expected. A low moving across the Yukon will spread heavy snow to Dawson and southern sections of the Dempster beginning tonight and continuing through Thursday. Gusty winds near the Richardson Mountains will also lead to local blowing snow over the Dempster overnight and Thursday. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-26T03:38:09-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-25T11:39:09-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0627562220.2020
Area: Dawson, Dempster
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A prolonged period of heavy rain is forecast for the central coast of British Columbia for Thursday and Friday. A couple of frontal waves will make landfall on the central coast of British Columbia on Thursday and Friday. The total rainfall amount from the two sets of frontal waves is forecast to be near 100 mm. The forecast heavy rain on top of antecedent moisture may result in localised flooding or road washouts. Environment and Climate Change Canada meteorologists will continue to refine the forecasts. Rainfall warnings may be issued as the event draws closer. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-26T04:39:39-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-25T12:40:39-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1062663776.2020
Area: Central Coast - coastal sections, Central Coast - inland sections
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring. Areas of dense fog have developed overnight through Bulkley Valley and the Lakes District. Fog will clear this morning. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-25T22:50:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-25T12:59:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1684268668.2020
Area: Bulkley Valley, Lakes District
